post_text: Unfortunately due to spectators being unwilling to follow social distancing guidelines, we will not be continuing with our Friday Night Lights for the remainder of April. We hope you enjoyed our Friday night glow for our Seniors.
text: Unfortunately due to spectators being unwilling to follow social distancing guidelines, we will not be continuing with our Friday Night Lights for the remainder of April. We hope you enjoyed our Friday night glow for our Seniors.

post_text:
Don't forget, DHS will be joining schools around the country by turning on our baseball and softball field lights tonight at 8:20 p.m., which is 20:20 military time and leaving them lit for 20 minutes and 20 seconds to honor the class of 2020.

On Friday nights in April, look toward DHS to see the glow of our support for our graduating class of 2020.

If you decide to visit and see the lights close, please remember to follow social distancing guidelines and remain in your vehicles.

post_text: April Board of Education Meeting
text: April Board of Education Meeting

post_text:
In case you haven’t heard, Governor Parson ordered all schools to remain closed through the remainder of the academic school year. We will continue our distance learning program through May 15th.

We will also continue to provide meals to our students.

Please feel free to contact us, if you have any questions or concerns.
text:
In case you haven’t heard, Governor Parson ordered all schools to remain closed through the remainder of the academic school year. We will continue our distance learning program through May 15th.

We will also continue to provide meals to our students.

Please feel free to contact us, if you have any questions or concerns.

post_text:
Starting Friday night on April 10th, DHS will be joining schools around the country by turning on our baseball and softball field lights on Friday nights at 8:20 p.m., which is 20:20 military time and leaving them lit for 20 minutes and 20 seconds to honor the class of 2020.

On Friday nights in April, look toward DHS to see the glow of our support for our graduating class of 2020.

We would like to encourage anyone that has a sign in town to go ahead and congratulate our seniors. Let’s celebrate the class of 2020 and show them some love!
text:

We would like to encourage anyone that has a sign in town to go ahead and congratulate our seniors. Let’s celebrate the class of 2020 and show them some love!

post_text: PARENTS & GUARDIANS: Your students’ distance learning packets will be available for pickup on Monday, March 23rd from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. at your child’s school. We will be doing curbside pickup; stay in your car and packets will be brought to you. If possible, calling ahead with an approximate arrival time will help facilitate the process. High School driving students are welcome to pickup their own packets.

post_text:
PUBLIC SAFETY ANNOUNCEMENT FROM THE DIXON R-I SCHOOL DISTRICT AND THE PULASKI COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE

DUE TO THE EXTREME THREAT OF SEVERE FLASH FLOODING LATER THIS AFTERNOON, TONIGHT, AND TOMORROW WE ASK THAT ALL DRIVERS BE VERY DILIGENT AND ALERT FOR FLOODED AREAS ON THE ROADWAYS. PAY PARTICULAR ATTENTION TO LOW WATER CROSSINGS. ONCE IT GETS DARK, FLOODED AREAS BECOME MORE DIFFICULT TO SEE AND WE ASK THAT IF AT ALL POSSIBLE, DO NOT CROSS ANY LOW WATER CROSSINGS AFTER DARK. BY ALL MEANS FOLLOW THE SAYING, “TURN AROUND, DON’T DROWN!!”
text:

post_text:
Thanks to the community and Country Mart for another successful fundraising campaign for our students! Your efforts helped raise $566.40 for the District's Positive Behavior programs!

Pictured from left to right: Kerry Copeland, Store Manager at Dixon Country Mart; Duane Doyle, Superintendent.
text:
Thanks to the community and Country Mart for another successful fundraising campaign for our students! Your efforts helped raise $566.40 for the District's Positive Behavior programs!

Pictured from left to right: Kerry Copeland, Store Manager at Dixon Country Mart; Duane Doyle, Superintendent.

post_text: Early this morning we were notified of a potential bomb threat in our district at an unknown location. We have contacted Law Enforcement experts to assist us in this matter. We are currently initiating an evacuation and waiting for K9 sweeps. PLEASE let us handle this situation as needed and we will keep everyone updated. PLEASE stay away from the schools, thank you for your cooperation.
